heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 14 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 2.1°C) and feels like temperature (up 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 191 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 997 m), feels like temperature (up 4.4°C), outside temperature (up 2.8°C), and inside temperature (up 3.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 191.5m higher than yesterday, 422.7m lower than the past week, 996.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 557m to 1248m and averaged 1137.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
